oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burgos Ledger
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Business Accounts
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Salamanca Company was from Burgos, Northern Spain, one of the main centers of commercial networks stretching through Europe, Mediterranean and New World. Merchants of Burgos expanded their activities from exporting sheep fleece to financial services such as foreign remittance. Books were created with double entry method and found in a judiciary section of the Provincial Archive of Burgos.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Institute Centre for Information Modelling, University of Graz
